column4: Why are my blank DVD's coming up as a "CD-ROM" and not letting me burn them at all, instead of letting me burn them and regocnizing them as blank DVD's?
Why are my blank DVD's coming up as a "CD-ROM" and not letting me burn them at all, instead of letting me burn them and regocnizing them as blank DVD's?
maybe the media isn't blank? maybe you'd try with other blank dvd
This is the fifth blank DVD i've tried. They can't ALL be bad...>_>
have you been able to write any dvd in the past?
Not that I know of, but regular CD's I can burn no problem.
Haven't tried burning a DVD yet, till today.
have you tried with an application? let's say brasero, gnome baker, so on?
GnomeBaker and KDE, in addition to normal Nautilus.
perhaps you should check System > Preferences > Hardware Information to see if that device is able to burn dvds
My hardware info shows that I can.
my hardware information says I can burn DVD's/
System > Preferences > Removable Drives and Media
that has nothing to do with my problem.
in the Storage tab, verify that the "Burn a CD or DVD when a blank disc is inserted" option is checked
ok then i'm guess i couldn't help you, sorry
